item.title: Chuck add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description:
"Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy.
[misquote of a letter about wine, see quotes/831031]" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Chuck add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." -- May Sarton

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "As it has been said: Love and a cough cannot be concealed. Even a small cough. Even a small love." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Aaron Copland
item.description: "To stop the flow of music would be like the stopping of time itself, incredible and inconceivable." -- Aaron Copland

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Happiness is a warm puppy." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Jimi Hendrix
item.description: "I'm the one that's got to die when it's time for me to die, so let me live my life the way I want to." -- Jimi Hendrix

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Richard Llewellyn
item.description: "O, there is lovely to feel a book, a good book, firm in the hand, for its fatness holds rich promise, and you are hot inside to think of good hours to come." -- Richard Llewellyn

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Woodrow Wilson
item.description: "I not only use all the brains that I have, but all I can borrow." -- Woodrow Wilson

item.title: Chuck add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Chuck add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Harriet Beecher Stowe
item.description: "The longest way must have its close - the gloomiest night will wear on to a morning." -- Harriet Beecher Stowe

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Dumas Malone
item.description: "The boldness of his mind was sheathed in a scabbard of politeness." -- Dumas Malone

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "Don't loaf and invite inspiration; light out after it with a club." -- Jack London

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Chuck add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Weeds are flowers, too, once you get to know them." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Émile Zola
item.description: "If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud." -- Émile Zola

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Thomas Merton
item.description: "Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time." -- Thomas Merton

item.title: Chuck add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Life is for the living. Death is for the dead. Let life be like music. And death a note unsaid." -- Langston Hughes
